subtitles.title: What is My Schedule?
subtitles.content:
My Schedule is a tool that allows you to visualize your schedule in an intuitive way. This site also offers several options such as importing your standard schedule, organizing your different schedules, filtering certain events (for example classes or practical work), integrating your personal activities, visualizing the premises and their location, and many other things!

Known as ADE Scheduler, this tool was created in August 2019 by three students then entering their master's degree. Their goal was to offer a more complete and user-friendly alternative to the official timetable tool then in place. After five years of growing popularity and use by tens of thousands of students at UCLouvain, it became the official tool in September 2024, changing its name to My Schedule.

Free software originally developed by Gilles Poncelet, Louis Navarre and JÃ©rome Eertmans, My Schedule is now maintained by the UCLouvain IT teams.

subtitles.title: Connection and import
subtitles.content: When you log in for the first time, My Schedule automatically imports the standard schedule for your course.

subtitles.title: Deselect course codes from the standard schedule
subtitles.content: If some elective courses do not apply to you, you can deselect them by clicking on the pencil next to your course code on the left of the schedule page.

subtitles.title: Adding course codes
subtitles.content: You can add a course that is not in your standard schedule by entering its code (example: LCHIM1111, WFARM2121, BDROI1110, etc.).

subtitles.title: Selecting an event, group, etc.
subtitles.content: If you click on an activity in your schedule (or on the pencil next to the course code on the left of the schedule page), you will see all the events contained in this course, by type (lecture, practical work). This option allows you to choose your time groups, for example.

subtitles.title: Create events
subtitles.content: Student life is important, but your personal life is even more important! That's why you can add your own custom events to your calendar by clicking on + create an event.

title: Export
content:
My Schedule allows you to export your schedule to other calendar applications, such as Gmail (which allows you to import an external calendar) either by downloading an iCal file or via a subscription link.

Warning! We cannot guarantee the frequency of updates because it depends on your calendar application. My Schedule therefore remains the official interface for viewing your schedule.

subtitles.title: Download an iCal file
subtitles.content: One solution to export your schedule is to download it in iCalendar format. Then, this file can be easily imported into your main calendar. The problem with this approach is that any changes to your schedule will not be reflected in your calendar.

subtitles.title: Subscription links
subtitles.content: The best export solution that My schedule can offer you is certainly the subscription link. With this link, your calendar application will regularly update your activities (classes and personal events).
